conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true isometric cutaway 3D model: walls have height and thickness, multiple wall faces (top/side) are visible, interior volumes read as rooms, and the ceiling/roof is removed to expose the interior.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D extrusion with readable wall thickness and corners; clear floor vs wall separation; clean cutaway with only minor simplification in small partitions/openings.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall room set and adjacency largely match (bedroom left/top, living-dining center, kitchen right, toilet near center-top, utility top-right, balcony bottom-left, foyer bottom-right). Some proportional/partition placement looks slightly simplified (notably around foyer/kitchen/utility junctions and small wall offsets).

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture and fixtures are present: bed/wardrobe, dining table, sofa, kitchen counters/hob, bathroom fixtures, utility counter. Minor omissions/simplifications in smaller built-ins/details.

visual_clarity.notes: Geometry is clean and readable with consistent materials; lighting/shadows do not heavily obscure layout. Some openings/door swings are faint and could be clearer.

detected_errors.description: Minor layout/proportion deviations and simplification of small partitions (especially around foyer/kitchen/utility transitions) compared to the 2D plan.
Some door/window/opening placements and sizes appear simplified; not all openings can be verified as perfectly matching the 2D plan.
Render clarity for thin elements (door arcs/window frames) is slightly reduced, making exact opening verification harder.

summary: A true 3D cutaway conversion with strong fidelity to the 2D layout, with only minor proportional and opening/partition simplifications.
